video.title: The Key To Learn Software Development
video.description:
Discover the key to learning software development. Spoiler: It's consistency.

Check out Dylan Israel's main channel:
https://www.YouTube.com/CodingTutorials360

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: RunOs
topLevelComment.text: The road to becoming a developer is not a one-size-fits-all model. It this guy gave up on friendships, free time, and everything else, so he could reach success, it doesn't mean yous hould have to do the same. Everyone has their way of learning and getting to their goals. Take this guys advise with a grain of salt.

topLevelComment.text: If you have youtube ?

topLevelComment.author: MrChris7582
topLevelComment.text: I just finished the html css section of free code camps have a job have 3 kids a wife ect. I just wait till the kids go to bed at night and work on it from 9pm-12am every night. I just have 0 social life anymore but its hard to do that with young kids anyways.

topLevelComment.author: Lasgoboze
topLevelComment.text:
1. Get rid of distractions.
2. Set a schedule. 
3. Clearly defined Milestones. - Having goals
4. Stay Consistent 
5. Be Flexible with yourself.

replies.author: Matheus Felipe
replies.text:
Why don't support somebody that has a good course for your program language? You don't spend money on yourself to accelerate and learn watching and doing in sequence? this don't make sense at all. You must spend and apply money in your knowledge.

I agree, the internet has a lot of content, but sometimes you will spend time searching and find the same content apply superficially or explained in another way. 

I guess you should reconsider this topic 2, in my humble opinion of course :)

replies.author: Ou8y2k2
replies.text:
The Key To Learning Anything.
1. Search the comment section to save 12 minutes 15 seconds.
2. Don't pay for schooling or an education. The internet is full of information.
3. Set a schedule so you can stay consistent.
4. Make clearly defined milestones/goals and reward yourself for meeting them.
5. Pay it forward.
6. Be flexible with yourself.

topLevelComment.author: Andi Spo
topLevelComment.text: Hey Dylan! So i'm trying to become a web dev! When i started i had no knowledge at all! After a few months on freecodecamp i started to learn a few things, but got stuck on java! Now that's hard to learn....and to be honest i need some motivation to keep going on...Any advice?

replies.author: tryagain
replies.text: Give up and live without it for a while and you will see

replies.author: Andi Spo
replies.text: Tedd McGee i'm studying to get a degree in computing and network, that's most about hardware and cables! I do have access to the college library, that includes over 100k of ebooks! But most developers say that practice makes you better!

replies.author: Xocen
replies.text: Did you invest in any books, it's a lot easier to learn with a book to explain everything in detail

replies.author: Peter Cruckshank
replies.text: Andi Spo I would pick one languages and learn everything you can about it. Use it to build things, and you'll get better
